identificationModule.officialTitle: Piloting an Adaption of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia for Shift Workers (CBTI-Shift)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of the proposed study is to pilot test two behavioral sleep intervention strategies for improving insomnia among night shift working nurses.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Night shift nurses with insomnia who meet all study criteria will receive one of two insomnia therapies. The specific therapy for insomnia will be determine by chance (like a flip of a coin), with an equal chance to receive either cognitive-behavioral therapy for insomnia or multicomponent relaxation therapy for insomnia, both modified for shift workers. Both therapies will be conducted over telehealth by interventionists trained in behavioral sleep medicine.

conditions: Circadian Rhythm Sleep-Wake Disorders, Shift Work Type

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Participants are asked to refrain from mentioning any information about the treatment they receive when interacting with the investigator or outcomes assessors. Participants are asked not to share details of their treatment with other individuals at their workplace.

interventions.name: CBTI
interventions.description: Intervention includes education about sleep and behavioral and cognitive strategies to improve sleep

interventions.name: MRTI
interventions.description: Intervention includes education about sleep and behavioral and relaxation strategies to improve sleep

primaryOutcomes.description: Validated questionnaire; total score range between 0 and 28, with higher numbers representing greater insomnia severity
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at the post-treatment assessment (occurring at approximately 10 weeks)

primaryOutcomes.description: Defined as \[number of participants who complete minimal therapeutic dose (at least 4 sessions)\] / \[number of randomized participants in treatment arm\]
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the post-treatment assessment (occurring at approximately 10 weeks)

primaryOutcomes.description: For enrolled participants, attendance rates will be calculated as \[number of visits attended\] / \[number of total visits\]
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the post-treatment assessment (occurring at approximately 10 weeks)

primaryOutcomes.description: Validated questionnaire; total score range between 12 and 60, with higher numbers representing greater feasibility, acceptability, and appropriateness.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the post-treatment assessment (occurring at approximately 10 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Validated questionnaire; total score range between 9 and 63, with higher numbers representing greater fatigue.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at the post-treatment assessment (occurring at approximately 10 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in PROMIS Sleep Related Impairment 8 item
secondaryOutcomes.description: Validated questionnaire; total score range between 8-40, with higher numbers indicating greater sleep-related wake time impairment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At baseline and at the post-treatment assessment (occurring at approximately 10 weeks)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Current shift working nursing staff in Oregon
* Expect to continue on shift work schedule during the study
* Meets criteria for an insomnia disorder
* Elevated insomnia symptoms
* Have daily access to internet on a smartphone, tablet, or computer; and
* Can read and write in English

Exclusion Criteria:

* People with uncontrolled medical conditions
* Presence of safety risk or condition in which study participation may be ineffective or result in increased risk to safety
* Some current treatments for insomnia
* Permanent day, evening, or rotating shift schedule
* History of seizures or manic episode; or
* Current/expected pregnancy during the study period

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: De-identified data may be uploaded to a data repository to make it accessible for publication.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data will become available within 2 years after the publication of the results pertaining to the primary aims and will be available for at least 2 years.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Data will be shared only with investigators who have a clear and rigorous analytic plan and who sign a data use agreement with the principal investigator.
